name: Uplevel
title: Principal engineer
summary: Uplevel, a series-A startup hatched at Madrona Venture Labs, hired me as front-end SME for its main product offering (an engineering effectiveness dashboard) as it worked to achieve product/market fit.

contributions.item: Led front-end development of two different React SPA webapps (create-react-app and vite) delivering effectiveness dashboards for software engineering organizations, including Fortune 100 companies.
Owned front-end repository as SME, maintaining quality standards for front-end development

children.item: Conducted learning sessions, individual peer programming sessions

contributions.item: Led feature initiatives for the development team as project “anchor”

children.item: Served as team liaison with PMs
Negotiated technical requirements with PMs and design

contributions.item: Negotiated schema for REST data responses with back-end engineers.
Led front-end engineering efforts on error handling and monitoring.
Led front-end engineering efforts on i18n and l10n.

Developed a hackathon project that was integrated into the production app: a custom React hook to manage query parameters which enabled flexible sharing of UI state for customer data visibility and greater efficiency during QA cycles.

name: Northeastern University
title: Part-time Lecturer
summary: Northeastern University invited me to create and teach a weekly 3-hour lecture and practical applications course for grad-level students, focusing on the basics of front-end development: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, usability and accessibility best practices in web UI design and development.

contributions.item: Prepared lectures, homework, and tests for a 10-week course.
Delivered weekly 3-hour lectures.
Managed Github repositories and organizations for class lecture notes and group assignments.
Facilitated class discussions via Canvas learning platform.
Conducted weekly office hours to provide guidance and mentorship to students.
Supervised a TA in grading and providing feedback on weekly homework and tests.
Managed class administration via Canvas learning platform.

name: The Climate Corporation
title: Staff software developer
summary: As a staff engineer for The Climate Corporationâ€™s Insights web team, I supported the desktop and webview UI. I also led the initiative to build the next iteration of our internal React component asset library.

contributions.item: Led front-end development of React app to integrate digital farming diagnostic equipment with farm field mapping and CRUD operations.
Collaborated closely with design teams in California and Missouri to test and validate use cases.
Led project to refactor and improve internal React library for use by internal front-end development team with an eye towards extensibility and accessibility.
Maintained quality standards for front-end development:

children.item: Conducted technical presentations and brown bag sessions

name: Wetpaint
title: Front-end software developer
summary: I was hired by Wetpaint to supplement its growing development team supporting dynamic entertainment content for women aged 18-34.

contributions.item: Supported UI for the Wetpaint consumer experience website and associated products.
Drove conversion to a responsive layout to serve both desktop and mobile users.
Led implementation of site redesign.

name: Aptimus (Apollo Education Group)
title: Front-end software developer
summary: I was hired By Aptimus as the cornerstone of a growing front-end development team tasked with supporting the University of Phoenix marketing website (http://www.phoenix.edu), a high-traffic site that receives millions of page views every month. As Led UI developer, I create dynamic, data-driven templates and components utilized by the Apollo Group web content strategy team to build the UOPX website.

contributions.item: Led development of template UI for UOPX homepage, degree-program pages, course pages and continuing education mini-site (many of the site’s highest-visibility pages), as well as various extensible components.
Collaborated closely with UX design teams in Arizona to test and validate use cases.
Spearheaded integration of Backbone MVC framework in codebase from research through implementation to standardize team Javascript coding efforts.
Led key CSS refactoring efforts to reduce CSS load times and improve development efficiency.
Mentored junior developers in Day (Adobe) CQ enterprise CMS development and JavaScript.
Initiated project to support responsive presentation for mobile devices via implementation of Bootstrap.

name: Zillow.com
title: Front-end software developer
summary: I was recruited by Zillow.com to provide development expertise with regard to UI.

contributions.item: Developed UI for Zillow Professional Directory.
Presented talk advocating for semantic HTML development during Zillow Developer Presentation.
Contributed core Web 2.0 concepts such as standards-based development; code validation; and separation of structure, presentation and behavior into Zillow codebase.

name: Seismic Interactive & Design
title: Web designer/developer
summary: I was hired to guide development of company into full-service interactive agency, implement processes for small- and large-scale web project development and provide advanced level of design/development expertise with regard to UI and programming. I implemented all phases of site development; mentored co-workers in web development skills; administrated Linux-based dedicated server and in-house Internet connectivity infrastructure on a day-to-day operational basis; and provided Internet technologies consulting for 20+ employees of strategic-management affiliate company.

contributions.item: Created proprietary WAVE<sup>™</sup> client needs evaluation, which was implemented as standard procedure in project exploratory process.
Managed transfer of client websites to in-house dedicated server, allowing company to generate new revenue stream and significantly reduce third-party website hosting expenses.
Headed technical development of ADDY award-winning projects

children.item: Green Bay Chamber of Commerce “Shine” interactive CD (2003)
Green Bay Chamber of Commerce “A Place To Shine” website (2006)

contributions.item: Integrated core Web 2.0 concepts such as standards-based development; code validation; and separation of structure, presentation and behavior into company web development process.

name: FutureLook, Inc.
title: Web designer/developer
summary: I was contracted to provide seamless continuity of website development during a critical transitional period. During this time, I implemented all phases of site development.

contributions.item: Implemented all phases of site design and development

name: Pulse Communications
title: Web designer/developer
summary: I was hired to guide development of company into full-service interactive agency, implement processes for small- and large-scale web project development and provide advanced level of design/development expertise with regard to UI and programming. I implemented all phases of site development; mentored co-workers in web development skills; administrated Linux-based dedicated server and in-house Internet connectivity infrastructure on a day-to-day operational basis; and provided Internet technologies consulting for 20+ employees of strategic-management affiliate company.

contributions.item: Implemented all phases of site design and development.
Mentored colleagues in front-end development.
Developed interactive trade show kiosk, increasing client’s product sales by 625%. (25 systems vs. 4 systems in previous year).
Proposed, built and deployed company intranet to improve internal communication and project coordination.
